original_recipe:
Prep Time: 17 mins
Cook Time: 20 mins
Total Time: 37 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 pound chicken, cut into bite sized pieces
2 cups chopped mushrooms
2 cups chopped zucchini
1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes, diced
2 teaspoons herbes de Provence
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the chicken to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the mushrooms and zucchini and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the potatoes along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

Prep Time: 18 mins
Cook Time: 30 mins
Total Time: 48 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 pound chicken, cut into bite sized pieces
2 cups chopped zucchini
2 cups chopped carrots
4 cups low sodium chicken broth
2 teaspoons chili powder
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
Use low sodium broth or homemade unsalted broth.
Skip added salt and finish with lemon juice and extra herbs.

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the zucchini and carrots and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the broth and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the broccoli and spinach and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the broth and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

1 1/2 cups uncooked white rice
1 can diced tomatoes, about 14 ounces
2 teaspoons smoked paprika
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the salmon to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the cherry tomatoes and snap peas and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the rice along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

2 cups cooked lentils or 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
2 cups chopped snap peas
2 cups chopped green beans
4 cups low sodium chicken broth
2 teaspoons smoked paprika
1/2 teaspoon black pepper

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the snap peas and green beans and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the broth and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

3 cloves garlic, minced
1 pound shrimp, cut into bite sized pieces
2 cups chopped cherry tomatoes
2 cups chopped zucchini
4 cups low sodium chicken broth
2 teaspoons ground cumin
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 cup heavy cream

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the cherry tomatoes and zucchini and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the broth along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

3. Add the turkey to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the bell peppers and carrots and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the rice along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/4 cup broth plus 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar in place of soy sauce

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the cherry tomatoes and zucchini and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the rice and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

Prep Time: 16 mins
Cook Time: 33 mins
Total Time: 49 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
14 ounces extra firm tofu, pressed and cubed
2 cups chopped carrots
2 cups chopped snap peas
1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes, diced
2 teaspoons Italian seasoning
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/3 cup chopped almonds or cashews

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the tofu to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the carrots and snap peas and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the potatoes along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

Prep Time: 23 mins
Cook Time: 29 mins
Total Time: 52 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
14 ounces extra firm tofu, pressed and cubed
2 cups chopped broccoli
2 cups chopped carrots
4 cups low sodium chicken broth
2 teaspoons Italian seasoning
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1 cup unsweetened almond milk or oat milk
1/4 cup nutritional yeast

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the broccoli and carrots and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the broth and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

original_recipe:
Prep Time: 17 mins
Cook Time: 29 mins
Total Time: 46 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
2 cups cooked lentils
2 cups chopped spinach
2 cups chopped kale
1 1/2 cups uncooked white rice
2 teaspoons ground cumin
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 cup heavy cream

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the lentil to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the spinach and kale and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the rice along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

4. Add the broccoli and carrots and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the tortillas or buns and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the chickpea to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the snap peas and bell peppers and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the pasta along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.

8 small flour tortillas or 4 burger buns
2 teaspoons turmeric
1/2 teaspoon black pepper

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the bell peppers and kale and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the tortillas or buns and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

Total Time: 55 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
12 ounces sliced mushrooms
2 cups chopped cherry tomatoes
2 cups chopped bell peppers
8 small flour tortillas or 4 burger buns
2 teaspoons chili powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
3 tablespoons soy sauce

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the mushroom to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until lightly browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes.
4. Add the cherry tomatoes and bell peppers and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the tortillas or buns along with any broth or tomatoes that are listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the starch or grains are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.
modified_recipe:
Prep Time: 19 mins
Cook Time: 33 mins
Total Time: 52 mins
Servings: 4

Ingredients
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
12 ounces sliced mushrooms
2 cups chopped cherry tomatoes
2 cups chopped bell peppers
8 small flour tortillas or 4 burger buns
2 teaspoons chili powder
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/4 cup broth plus 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar in place of soy sauce

Directions
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and lightly golden, about 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute, just until fragrant.
3. Add the protein to the pan and cook, stirring now and then, until it is starting to brown and is mostly cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Add the cherry tomatoes and bell peppers and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. Stir in the tortillas or buns and any broth or plant based milk that is listed. Mix well and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the vegetables and base are tender and most of the liquid has reduced, 15 to 20 minutes, stirring once or twice.
7. If you are using plant milk or nutritional yeast, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking to create a creamy sauce. Taste and adjust with herbs, black pepper, or lemon juice instead of extra salt.
8. Remove the pan from the heat and serve hot as a complete meal that follows the dietary restriction.

7. If you are using cream or cheese, stir them in during the last few minutes of cooking until melted and the sauce is thickened. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
8. Remove the pan from the heat, let it sit for a minute, then serve hot.
